intro: Alsine rostrata proles burnatii, commonly known as the Burnatii sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
